## TimeSpan.compareTo() method

Compares this instance to a specified TimeSpan object and returns an integer that indicates whether this instance is shorter than, equal to, or longer than the TimeSpan object.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
compareTo(value: TimeSpan): number;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  value | TimeSpan | An object to compare to this instance. |

<b>Returns:</b>

number

number - A signed number indicating the relative values of this instance and value. "A negative integer": This instance is shorter than value. "Zero": This instance is equal to value. "A positive integer": This instance is longer than value.
